topic: Large Language Models Robustness Research

  entities:
    Wang et al.|Research Group
    Han et al.|Research Group
    Shen et al.|Research Group
    Park et al.|Research Group
    Jiang et al.|Research Group
    Xiong et al.|Research Group
    Large Language Models|Model
    GLUE|Dataset
    CNN/DailyMail|Dataset
    KeyBERT|Tool
    LLM-as-a-Judge|Method

  proposition: Wang et al. studied out-of-distribution classification tasks for Large Language Models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Wang et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: Han et al. examined Large Language Models' performance in information extraction with perturbed structured data.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Han et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: Shen et al. analyzed question-answering tasks and the impact of adversarial perturbations on Large Language Models' accuracy.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Shen et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: Existing research benchmarks for Large Language Models have limitations due to rapid model development.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Research Benchmarks|DESCRIBED_BY|limitations
    
  proposition: Fixed datasets struggle to keep pace with evolving Large Language Models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Datasets|DESCRIBED_BY|struggle to keep pace
    
  proposition: Models may be optimized to perform well on specific benchmarks, potentially misrepresenting real-world performance.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Models|POTENTIAL_ISSUE|misrepresenting real-world performance
    
  proposition: Park et al. incorporated stylistic variations into model training to enhance resilience against adversarial attacks.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Park et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: Jiang et al. designed prompts to minimize the influence of irrelevant information in Large Language Models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Jiang et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: Xiong et al. used graph-based techniques to protect Large Language Models from adversarial perturbation attacks.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Xiong et al.|RESEARCHED|Large Language Models
    
  proposition: For annotated datasets, robustness score is the proportion of samples with consistent responses before and after perturbations.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Robustness Score|CALCULATED_BY|proportion of consistent samples
    
  proposition: For open-ended datasets, robustness score uses the LLM-as-a-Judge framework.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Robustness Score|EVALUATED_BY|LLM-as-a-Judge
    
  proposition: LLM-as-a-Judge compares model responses under perturbed and unperturbed conditions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    LLM-as-a-Judge|FUNCTION|compare model responses
    
  proposition: Robustness score represents the proportion of instances classified as a "Tie".
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Robustness Score|DEFINED_BY|proportion of "Tie" instances

topic: Perturbation Techniques

  entities:
    Spelling Mistake|Technological Concept
    Emoji Insertion|Technological Concept
    Social Tagging|Technological Concept
    Spaced Uppercase|Technological Concept
    Multilingual Blend|Technological Concept
    Distractive Text|Technological Concept
    Syntactic Disruptions|Technological Concept
    Recondite Words|Technological Concept
    KeyBERT|Tool
    Large Language Models|Model

  proposition: Spelling Mistake simulates common writing errors.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Spelling Mistake|DESCRIBED_BY|simulates common writing errors
    
  proposition: Emoji Insertion imitates social media communication style.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Emoji Insertion|DESCRIBED_BY|imitates social media communication style
    
  proposition: Social Tagging reflects hashtag and mention practices.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Social Tagging|DESCRIBED_BY|reflects hashtag and mention practices
    
  proposition: Spaced Uppercase emphasizes words through letter spacing.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Spaced Uppercase|DESCRIBED_BY|emphasizes words through letter spacing
    
  proposition: Multilingual Blend mixes multiple languages.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Multilingual Blend|DESCRIBED_BY|mixes multiple languages
    
  proposition: Distractive Text includes off-topic content.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Distractive Text|DESCRIBED_BY|includes off-topic content
    
  proposition: Syntactic Disruptions alter grammatical structure.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Syntactic Disruptions|DESCRIBED_BY|alter grammatical structure
    
  proposition: Recondite Words use obscure vocabulary.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Recondite Words|DESCRIBED_BY|use obscure vocabulary
    
  proposition: KeyBERT used for Spelling Mistake, Emoji Insertion, and Spaced Uppercase.
    entity-entity relationships:
    KeyBERT|APPLIED_TO|Spelling Mistake
    KeyBERT|APPLIED_TO|Emoji Insertion
    KeyBERT|APPLIED_TO|Spaced Uppercase
    
  proposition: Large Language Models generate subtitles for Social Tagging.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Large Language Models|GENERATE|Social Tagging
    
  proposition: Multilingual Blend involves word and sentence-level translations.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Multilingual Blend|INVOLVES|word and sentence-level translations
    
  proposition: Specific LLM prompts introduce Distractive Text, Syntactic Disruptions, and Recondite Words.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Large Language Models|INTRODUCE|Distractive Text
    Large Language Models|INTRODUCE|Syntactic Disruptions
    Large Language Models|INTRODUCE|Recondite Words
